response.answer_text: A nanometer is a billionth of a meter. A very short distance that we can't physically see but we can measure with instruments. What do we measure in nanometers (nm)? Wavelengths of light in 100s of nm. Transistor dimensions in microprocessors in tens of nm. Viruses a few nm.

Wave lengths of light. Red LED light is about 660nM and blue LED is near 440nM a UV LED has a wavelength of 395nM. Modern microprocessors mad by Intel are currently using 15nM features. SRAMs (memories) use feature sizes of about 30nM.
